thread.title: Florida Teen Injured After Struck By Train-Train Hits and Drags College Freshman
thread.title_full: Florida Teen Injured After Struck By Train-Train Hits and Drags College Freshman

author: Samantha Swantek
title: Florida Teen Injured After Struck By Train-Train Hits and Drags College Freshman

organizations.name: drags college freshman florida teen suffers serious injuries

text:
Florida Teen Suffers Serious Injuries After Being Struck By Train While Taking "Artistic" Photos 
She was posing for a picture on the railroad tracks. Trulia; Facebook By Samantha Swantek Feb 06, 2017 A University of West Florida college student was critically injured after being struck and dragged by a train along Scenic Highway in Pensacola, FL. Julia Laureano, 18, was reportedly posing for an artistic picture along the train’s tracks in Bay Bluffs Park when she was hit. #Florida teen getting her picture taken as train rolled by is hit by train, dragged 40 feet, somehow survives. https://t.co/y4b0RFBUIZ — Craig Pittman (@craigtimes) February 3, 2017 Advertisement - Continue Reading Below ABC affiliate WEARTV reports that the locomotive hit Laureano and, “dragged her several feet before she fell off onto some rocks.” The UWF college freshman was rushed to Pensacola’s Sacred Heart Hospital following the accident. Laureano’s friend Leah Bateman, 20, was photographing her, and was snapping "artistic" shots of her, The Daily Mail reports , with an oncoming train in the background. Bateman was not harmed in the incident. #Pensacola police investigating accident after woman struck by train while taking a picture at Bay Bluffs Park. @weartv pic.twitter.com/FBIKjcmkPx — David Gonzalez (@davidgonz) February 3, 2017 Though she remains in hospital, the Pensacola Police Department has said Laureano's injuries are not life threatening, according to the Northwest Florida Daily News . Advertisement - Continue Reading Below
